title: improve diagnostic for passing sub-array instead of slice

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->


[playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=f5006503c3e88fb372a4a02e31d6373c)

```rust
fn foo() {
    let buf = [0u8; 100];
    println!("value of a is {:?}", buf[0..2]);
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0277]: the size for values of type `[u8]` cannot be known at compilation time
   --> src/lib.rs:5:5
    |
5   |     println!("value of a is {:?}", buf[0..2]);
    |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
    |
    = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `[u8]`
    = note: this error originates in the macro `$crate::format_args_nl` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
5   |     println!("value of a is {:?}", buf[0..2]);
    |                                    ^^^^^^^^^   consider &buf[0..2]
```
